message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: import java.util.StringTokenizer;

public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        String property = "007.customerclass = component:keyboard;determinantType:key;determinant:test;waste";
        StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(property, ":;=");
        while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
            String key = st.nextToken().trim();
            if (key.equals("component") || key.equals("determinantType") || key.equals("determinant")) {
                System.out.println(st.nextToken().trim());
            }
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The StringTokenizer class is used to split a string into tokens. In this code, we are using the StringTokenizer.nextToken() method to get the next token from the string. We are splitting the string by the delimiters ":" ";" and "=". We then check if the key equals "component", "determinantType", or "determinant". If it does, we print the next token, which is the value we want. This way, we can split the string into the desired parts.
